accused.name: Claudette Clauchepied
accused.spouse_name: Dieudonné de Taintrux (second husband, died 5-6 years before); Demenge Claudel Thouvenin of Champdray (first husband, died ~30 years before)

confession.devil_appearance: big man in black with claws
confession.seduction_date: 30 years before trial (c. 1571), 6 weeks after first encounter with devil between Vanemont and St. Leonard
confession.seduction_context: After first husband's death when destitute and begging. First met devil who offered money but refused. Second meeting: devil told her sister and children were dead, said she was beautiful, promised to be good master and she would never want, then seduced her and made her renounce God. Was so cold after intercourse had to spend 3 days at la Houssiere recovering.

devil_mark.description: Devil struck her behind right ear at first meeting (which she resisted), leaving her unconscious for 2 days and nights

powder_types: powder to sprinkle on food (strawberries, pears, cherries)
different powder used in milk to heal
sabbat_activities: taking pieces of lighted straw as if they were candles
kissing horse bone presented as pax by master sitting on table
feasting on meat like that of newborn children
greeted as 'la nouvelle venue' at first sabbat
no one spoke except when master rebuked her for being last to leave

witnesses.name: Marie femme Mengeon Francois le Jeusne
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: daughter of Margueritte le Sergent (with whom accused lodged)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Mother accused Claudette of causing her illness; Claudette responded defensively

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: during night while Claudette slept in barn

witnesses.name: Marion femme Nicolas Mengin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: patient whom Claudette claimed to have healed

testimony.quarrel_subject: Illness from touching beggar woman on arm, not from la Montenatte's soup as Claudette claimed

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: immediate (when touched on arm, became ill with fever for 2 years)

witnesses.name: Marion femme Claudel Mengeot and Barbon femme Colin Mengeot

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after she warned Dieudonné she had bad reputation before he married her

witnesses.name: Jean Bertrand
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: sought her healing services for wife

harms_alleged.attributed_to: unknown (Claudette said Jeandon and unnamed woman)
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after giving birth around St Martin

witnesses.name: Jeandon Bassat
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: fellow beggar and sometime associate in healing work

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused her of being 'une trompeuse' who didn't keep promises; incident with cat at Herpelmont
testimony.threat_quote: if she could not heal her she should leave her 'a tous les dyables'

harms_alleged.attributed_to: Jeandon Bassat (according to Claudette, later retracted)

harms_alleged.target: herself (pains in back and left side)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Overheard Claudette and Jeandon arguing, Jeandon said 'let's leave her to the devil'

harms_alleged.attributed_to: Jeandon Bassot (according to Claudette, later retracted)
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 2 years before, illness began in left leg then moved to shoulder

testimony.quarrel_subject: At wedding feast, Claudette warned about son running off; husband rewarded another child who fetched son, not Claudette

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next day after wedding feast incident

timeline.subject: Claudette Clauchepied
timeline.details: Substitut for PG des Vosges Adam Gaulthier informed that vagabond woman arrived to heal wife of Jean Bertrand; ordered prévôt to arrest her

timeline.subject: Claudette Clauchepied
timeline.details: First interrogation after arrest; gave biographical details, described healing powers from being born on Good Friday

timeline.subject: Claudette Clauchepied
timeline.details: Second interrogation about healing methods and specific incidents

timeline.subject: Claudette Clauchepied
timeline.details: Interrogation; she makes voluntary confession about meeting devil 23 years before

timeline.subject: Claudette Clauchepied
timeline.details: Makes full confession of pact with devil, attending sabbat, killing with powder

timeline.subject: Claudette Clauchepied
timeline.details: Confirmed confessions with additional details about sabbat and maleficia

timeline.subject: Claudette Clauchepied
timeline.details: PG calls for death sentence and that she feel fire before being strangled; torture requested to discover accomplices

timeline.subject: Claudette Clauchepied
timeline.details: Names accomplices: la Teuxenatte of Xenenat and Francois de l'Estraye; accuses Jeandon of causing illnesses

timeline.subject: Claudette Clauchepied
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

timeline.subject: Claudette Clauchepied
timeline.details: Racked; maintained only la Teuxenatte seen at sabbat; confronted with Jeandon who denied causing illnesses

timeline.subject: Claudette Clauchepied
timeline.details: Formal death sentence from court at Bruyères; afterwards confessed to Carmelite from Baccarat that she accused Jeandon falsely

timeline.subject: Jeandon Bassat
timeline.details: PG orders Jeandon be renvoyé jusques à rappel

accomplices_named.name: la Montenatte
accomplices_named.context: Named by Claudette as having poisoned soup given to Nicolas Mengin's wife; only accomplice she recognized at sabbat (others masked)

accomplices_named.name: la Teuxenatte (la Gueldrenatte)
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat; previously arrested and imprisoned at Arches but released; killed two sons of Michiel Coladat; now vagabond in fields

accomplices_named.name: Francois de l'Estraye (de la Treille)
accomplices_named.context: Another vagabond who wanted to marry her; when refused regularly called her witch; later admitted she accused him falsely in anger

accomplices_named.name: Jeandon Bassat
accomplices_named.context: Accused of causing illnesses (wife of Melchior Vaudechamps, daughter of Philippe Masson, wife of Jean Bertrand); arrested and imprisoned but she retracted all accusations before execution, saying she did so in hatred over cat incident

prior_accusations.context: Caught her beating water to make hail and beaten her; she feared him after this; called her witch
Chased her out because believed she killed Denys of Laveline-du-Houx; officers at Arches wanted to arrest her
Hated and called witch when she lived there with 'ung magister'

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudette Clauchepied
notable_quotes.french: que pour estre née le jour de grand vendredy pendant qu'on lisoit la passion, elle a heu de dieu ce don de grace, de cognoistre plusieurs maladies et dyviner sy elles procedoit de mal de saincts ou mal donné
notable_quotes.english: that for being born on Good Friday while the Passion was being read, she had from God this gift of grace, to know several illnesses and divine if they proceeded from illness given by saints or given illness [witchcraft]
notable_quotes.context: Explaining her claimed healing powers in first interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudette Clauchepied
notable_quotes.french: On scait que dieu est et nostre dame aussy, l'eaue n'a point de brie, le chemin n'a poinct de chie, le collon n'a poinct de fiel, parmy coeur vray vecie crauve, au nom du pere du filz et du saint Esprit
notable_quotes.english: We know that God is and Our Lady too, the water has no brie, the road has no chie, the colon has no bile, through true heart vecie crauve, in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit
notable_quotes.context: Prayer she used to diagnose if illness was from saints or witchcraft; would lose memory after 'coeur vray' if not from saint

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudette Clauchepied
notable_quotes.french: que sy elle luy avoit donné le mal, elle luy voulloit oster, mais qu'elle ne trouveroit gens qui luy osast maintenir
notable_quotes.english: that if she had given her the illness, she would remove it, but that she would not find people who would dare maintain it
notable_quotes.context: Response when Margueritte le Sergent's daughter accused her of causing mother's illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudette Clauchepied
notable_quotes.french: qu'il estoit trop tard, et qu'elle avoit ouy dire que quant une personne avoit receu les saincts sacrements qu'il n'y avoit plus moyen de la guerir
notable_quotes.english: that it was too late, and that she had heard say that when a person had received the holy sacraments there was no longer any way to heal them
notable_quotes.context: Explaining why she could not heal Margueritte le Sergent after she received sacraments

notable_quotes.speaker: Devil to Claudette
notable_quotes.context: Devil's words when she met him again after stealing two hens

notable_quotes.speaker: Devil to Claudette
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle estoit belle et qu'il avoit grande envye de la baiser
notable_quotes.english: that she was beautiful and that he had great desire to kiss her
notable_quotes.context: Devil's seduction, telling her sister and children were dead and goods seized

notable_quotes.speaker: Devil to Claudette
notable_quotes.french: disant qu'elle feroit mieulx que de rester au monde ainsy miserable et langoureuse
notable_quotes.english: saying that she would do better than to remain in the world thus miserable and languishing
notable_quotes.context: Voice in woods of Gerberviller 7 years before trial, telling her to drown herself

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeandon Bassot
notable_quotes.french: c'est ung mal donné, s'a faict quelqu'ung qui te monstre belle myne et beau semblant, je scay une femme que sy elle l'avoit veu elle la gueriroit
notable_quotes.english: it's a given illness, done by someone who shows you a beautiful face and pleasant appearance, I know a woman who if she had seen it she would cure her
notable_quotes.context: Jeandon telling Mengeon Masson about her daughter's illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudette Clauchepied
notable_quotes.french: Je prie a dieu et a la vierge Marie que jamais chance ne puisse tu avoir puis que tu me trompe ainsy
notable_quotes.english: I pray to God and the Virgin Mary that you may never have luck since you deceive me thus
notable_quotes.context: Curse on Grand Demenge who refused to repay loan; his arms became paralyzed for 3 months

notable_quotes.speaker: Devil (actual prayer beginning)
notable_quotes.french: C'est vray que le malheureux est et sa mere aussy
notable_quotes.english: It's true that the unfortunate one [devil] is and his mother too
notable_quotes.context: Claudette's confession that the prayer devil taught her actually began this way, not 'On scait que dieu est'

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeandon Bassot
notable_quotes.english: come on, let's leave her to the devil
notable_quotes.context: Overheard by Jacquette Vauldechamps muttering to Claudette about wife of Vauldechamps

relationships.evidence_text: daughter of Nicolas Clauchepied and Jehenne de Darnieulle
daughter of Nicolas Clauchepied and Jehenne de Darnieulle
first husband for 7 years of Champdray, had 2 children both died
second husband, herdsman at Hould, died after only 6 months, some 5 or 6 years earlier

relationships.person1: Marie femme Mengeon Francois le Jeusne
relationships.evidence_text: fille feu Jean le Sergent de Houx
Marion femme Nicolas Mengin de Granges
fellow beggars who sometimes worked together on healing and pilgrimage services

economic_context.details: Claudette was destitute after first husband sold and dissipated all her property. She became a beggar and itinerant healer. Economic desperation was context for devil's seduction. In confession, mentioned Grand Demenge refusing to repay loan, leading her to curse him. She earned money through healing services and was sometimes paid for making pilgrimages on behalf of sick people.

harms_catalog.harm_description: heard great noise like cats at night, felt rats running over her, pains in thighs and legs, could not walk
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Margueritte complained to Claudette about pains; Claudette responded defensively
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: during night while Claudette slept in barn
harms_catalog.method_alleged: night visitation (noise like cats, sensation of rats)

harms_catalog.harm_description: ill for 7 weeks, unable to use limbs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jehennon heard that when Dieudonné was about to marry Claudette, she warned him she had bad reputation

harms_catalog.harm_description: trouble with breasts, lost milk after childbirth, pains sometimes in throat, sometimes lower
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Jeandon Bassat and unnamed woman (according to Claudette)
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after giving birth around St Martin
harms_catalog.method_alleged: looking at her hand (Jeandon), woman also involved

harms_catalog.harm_description: pains in back and left side
illness beginning with left leg which became red, then moving up to shoulder
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Jeandon Bassat (according to Claudette, later retracted)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: girl refused Jeandon milk when he asked for it

harms_catalog.harm_description: sick for a year, unable to walk
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: At wedding feast, Claudette warned about son running off; husband rewarded other child who fetched son, not her

harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder put in field where they would pass

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Anthoine Claude ('homme à marier') gave her hopes of marriage but married another woman
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: at les Poulieres, shortly after his marriage

harms_catalog.harm_description: illness from poisoned pears, later healed
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: some 2 years before trial at Rehaupal
harms_catalog.method_alleged: gave her two pears sprinkled with powder; later healed her with different powder in bowl of milk

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Demenge des Femmes beat her and hurt her hand so she couldn't work; refused work from Nicolas Pierrat; Pierrat suggested she was disobliging

harms_catalog.victim_name: small daughter of woman at Giromesnil in Burgundy
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: another woman hated her and called her 'estrangere et lorainche'; devil said take revenge on daughter
Catherine rebuked and threatened her because she wouldn't agree to go with her to Burgundy
harms_catalog.method_alleged: gave her apple provided by master

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: would not give her work in mines
harms_catalog.method_alleged: poisoning cherries in his garden; later repented and healed him with parsley from garden in soup

harms_catalog.victim_name: Grand Demenge (brother of Claude le Lorrain)
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cursed him; when he repaid money, rubbed his clothes with herb given by master to cure him

harms_catalog.victim_name: horse of Anthoine Tabourin of Biffontaine
harms_catalog.harm_description: attempted to make ill but didn't work
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Anthoine reproached her with coming so often, asking why she didn't work
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder (failed because he was good man)

used to cure jaundice, applied while saying prayers

pilgrimage site recommended for healing

weather_events: hail (allegedly made by beating water with stick - Demenge des Femmes claimed to have seen this)
economic_hardship_indicators: accused was vagabond beggar with no property or money
first husband sold and dissipated all her property
devil's seduction exploited her desperation and destitution
earned money through healing services and begging
worked as domestic servant between periods of begging
ate horse flesh (gruatte) from dead animals
extreme poverty noted at end: 'neither property nor money, and was vagabonde'
religious_calendar_references: Good Friday (claimed birth on this day during reading of Passion)
St Martin (Germaine gave birth around this feast)
dimanche des Brandons (Sunday of Brandons when servant visited Claudette)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Suspected of killing cat belonging to Lieger Didier at Herpelmont and taking away its head; gave Jeandon 6 gros to excuse her; later emerged cat was killed by beggar-woman from Nancy
Stole two hens near Gerardmer after first meeting with devil; immediately taken back by owner

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Jeandon spoke to her through prison window; imprisoned at Bruyères

change_de_nancy.modification_details: PG requested death by strangulation after feeling the fire; Change de Nancy approved this on March 31, 1601

hearsay_chains.content: what Claudette said about Jean Bertrand's wife's illness and need for pilgrimage
that when Dieudonné was about to marry Claudette she warned him of bad reputation, then Jehennon was ill 7 weeks
that Claudette had healed various people
that Jeandon knew woman who might help heal
claimed accused caused her to lose use of legs because refused piece of bread

emotional_state_notes: seemed to cry when Margueritte le Sergent complained
became confused when asked how she knew Jeandon caused illness
disconcerted when judges pointed out no special grace in her healing methods

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Accused Jeandon of causing illnesses, but later admitted she did so falsely in hatred over cat incident and threats he made

third_parties.name: comte de Montbeliard
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: patient she claimed to have healed
third_parties.context: She claimed to have cured him 15-16 years before when he suffered from illness given by male witch neighbor; made him drinks with apothecary drugs and garden herbs so he vomited up lizard and ball of thread with bones; male witch was arrested and executed within 2 days having been witch for 22 years

third_parties.name: Gerard Contet
third_parties.context: From Gerardmer; found her after she lay 2 days and nights after devil struck her behind ear; praised her for resisting seduction and took her to his house

third_parties.name: la Montenatte
third_parties.context: Claudette said she made soup for Nicolas Mengin's wife that would make her sick; only accomplice recognized at sabbat; feared as witch

third_parties.name: Demenge des Femmes
third_parties.context: Claimed he caught her beating water to make hail and beaten her; called her witch; she feared him; asked her to cure his bad leg; in confession she said he beat her and hurt her hand 9 years before

third_parties.name: Tante Annon
third_parties.context: Consulted by Mengeon Masson about daughter's illness before Claudette; recommended bathing with herbs of St Jean but things got worse

third_parties.name: la Gueldrenatte (la Guealdrenatte)
third_parties.context: From Belmont; Jacquotte Vauldechamps engaged her to go to Bel Bernard when Jeandon failed; brought back vinegar and blessed bread which cured in 2-3 days; Claudette said she'd only seen her once

third_parties.name: male witch neighbor of comte de Montbeliard's castle
third_parties.context: According to Claudette, responsible for comte's illness; arrested and executed within 2 days; had been witch for 22 years; comte already knew his identity

third_parties.name: Anthoine Galmeche
third_parties.context: Of Champs; sometimes stayed in his house when begging

third_parties.name: Jean Duguenot
third_parties.context: Of Champs; sometimes stayed in his house when begging

third_parties.name: Jehennon
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: stepdaughter of person who lodged her
third_parties.context: Stepdaughter of Anthoine Galmeche; ill for 7 weeks unable to use limbs after Claudette warned Dieudonné of bad reputation before marriage

third_parties.name: Messire Jean of Grainges
third_parties.context: She worked for him sarclant du millet with la Montenatte

third_parties.name: Lieger Didier
third_parties.context: Of Herpelmont; his cat was killed (but by beggar-woman from Nancy, not Claudette)

third_parties.name: Jacat Ferry
third_parties.context: Of Laval; Jeandon and Claudette met at his house 4 years before; she took gruatte from his dead horse

third_parties.name: Jean Claudine
third_parties.context: Neighbor of Jean Bertrand; Jeandon brought Claudette to his house where wife had long been sick; he was uncertain about employing her due to expense

third_parties.name: Jean Grillot
third_parties.context: One of people Claudette claimed to have healed

third_parties.name: Mengeon Dondez
third_parties.context: Of Champdray; often mocked her; she killed 2-3 of his cows with powder 7-8 years before

third_parties.name: Anthoine Claude
third_parties.context: 'homme à marier' at les Poulieres; she served him; gave her hopes of marriage but married another; she killed 2 of his cows in revenge

third_parties.name: Pierrat Collenel
third_parties.context: Of Rehaupal; she gave poisoned pears to his daughter-in-law Mengeotte 2 years before

third_parties.name: Nicolas Pierrat
third_parties.context: Of Granges; offered her work which she refused after Demenge des Femmes beat her; suggested she was disobliging; she put powder in his plate and he languished and died

third_parties.name: Catherine (poor woman)
third_parties.context: Near Ramonchamps 15 years before; rebuked Claudette for not agreeing to go to Burgundy; died in 3 weeks from poisoned apple

third_parties.name: Claude le Lorrain
third_parties.context: Of Giromesnil 20 years before; would not give her work in mines; she poisoned cherries in his garden; later repented and healed him

third_parties.name: Grand Demenge
third_parties.context: Brother of Claude le Lorrain; refused to pay back loan; she cursed him; arms paralyzed 3 months until he repaid

third_parties.name: Anthoine Tabourin
third_parties.context: Of Biffontaine 6-7 years before; reproached her for coming often and not working; she tried to make his horse ill but failed

third_parties.name: la Teuxenatte
third_parties.context: Of Xenenat; seen at sabbat; previously arrested at Arches but released; killed two sons of Michiel Coladat; now vagabond

third_parties.name: Michiel Coladat
third_parties.context: Of Xenenat; la Teuxenatte killed his two sons; Claudette told him of this so he had her arrested

third_parties.name: Francois de l'Estraye (de la Treille)
third_parties.context: Another vagabond who wanted to marry her; when refused regularly called her witch; she accused him as accomplice but later admitted it was false, done in anger

extraction_metadata.notes: Extremely detailed trial record with extensive witness testimony (14 witnesses), multiple interrogations, voluntary confession followed by confession under torture, and significant economic/social context. Claudette was an itinerant healer/diviner who practiced 'white magic' healing but confessed under pressure to devil's pact and sabbat attendance spanning 30 years. Notable for: 1) her resistance to devil at first meeting, 2) her ambivalence about harming people (often repented and healed them), 3) complex relationship with fellow beggar Jeandon whom she falsely accused then exonerated before execution, 4) economic desperation as context for devil's seduction, 5) rich detail about popular healing practices (pilgrimages, prayers, material remedies), 6) extensive maleficia catalog spanning decades and locations. Trial costs: 51 francs 8 gros. Sentence: death by strangulation after feeling the fire. Jeandon Bassat was arrested based on her accusations but released ('renvoyé jusques à rappel') after she retracted under torture and to Carmelite confessor.
